Reviews.Title: “A Nice Relaxing Resort”
Reviews.Author: kingstupka
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hacienda Vista Real twice and each time had a pleasant and relaxing time. The room was clean and nicely decorated. There is an Italian restaurant outside the entrance to Villas Pakal with really amazingly good food. It was called Latina's. Go there if you stay in Playacar, you will not regret it! My parents were staying nearby and the lady at the front desk went out of her way to help my father with a wheel chair when they came to the pool for lunch one day. Great service and lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Di W
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks better than the photos. Some of the reviews say the hotel feels deserted, which in NOT true. It is a quiet and peaceful place, kept in good shape. Bathroom is kind of small. The hotel is Playacar area, with 2 security doors. Feels safe and exclusive. Also close to the Fifth avenue with all the restaurant and shops. The one bedroom suite is big enough for couples or family with 1-2 children. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great choice in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Car0linian
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place. I was in a standard room and thought about upgrading but honestly it is really enormous for one person so didn't bother. Peeked into a one bedroom as it was being cleaned, absolutely ENORMOUS and spotless. If you are here as a couple or family hard to beat it. Poolside breakfast is really nice. I found the distance to town a plus quite frankly. Playa del Carmen is so boisterous at night, and it goes ALL night, so this is such a welcome respite. Who wants to listen to all that while trying to sleep? this is perfect, 15 minute walk or $5 cab ride. They booked all my daytime excursions and the frontdesk is very attentive. They called each evening to ask if everything was alright in my room. The one thing I did tell them, that the showerhead was only facing down and I'm tall, was fixed immediately- actually replaced. If you are looking to be in the center of it all and don't mind the noise then you may not like this, but if you want to have a buffer zone between you and all the mayhem this is perfect. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “what a treat !!”
Reviews.Author: flyeroli
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation through the internet based on the hotels website and a special price offer if booked and paid for in advance. As we would be leaving after a month in Mexico the next day I thought it would be nice to stay at a hotel with some nicer amenities and pay abit more than normal so we could enjoy a relaxed morning in a pleasant local prior to a long afternoon and evening of traveling. We arrived early afternoon, taking a $7 taxi from the ferry terminal to the hotel located in the playacar complex just south ( a pleasant 15 minute walk) from Playa's busy 5th avenue. The management at the desk located our reservation and as we were early understandably asked us to wait 20 minutes for our room which we did in their pleasant lobby overlooking the pool and a view of the adjacent golf course. We were given water and were surprised to find our &70 dollar standard room had been upgraded to a luxurious deluxe suite- what a treat. Marble floors, a gorgeous balcony with view of the beautiful grounds, full kitchen, modern, bathroom and bed room. The staff as we have found throughout Mexico was professional, polite and dedicated, their pride in their work and their obvious contentment in their jobs creates an atmosphere that makes your stay all the more enjoyable. On top of everything described included was a wonderful buffet breakfast by the pool with multiple choices native and european choices from papaya and motelenos to hot cakes and coffee cake. What a way to end a vacation or for that matter to start one which is exactly what we will do next year when we return to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best part of my trip!”
Reviews.Author: Worshashore
Reviews.Content: I run a bed and breakfast. I know the work involved in providing an excellent customer experience. This establishment does it in spades. My suite was larger than most apartments I've lived in. Full Living room, Dining room, Kitchen (I like to cook, and could have used more cooking equipment, and there was no coffee maker, but most people don't cook on vacation, so I get it). Huge bedroom with a fantastic bed. I slept better than I ever have on a vacation. A nice bathroom with seperate shower and jacuzzi tub, 4, yes, 4 balconies on the 1st floor, and an enormous wrap around balcony on the rooftop, with a private hot tub, which, fortunately, was not heated at the time, and I used as a plunge pool. A hot tub seems out of place anyway, considering the temperature in Playa. 85 degrees every day. The suite has beautiful vaulted brick ceilings throughout. A very nice touch. And the view of Cozumel from the roof deck was a nice surprise. The staff was very courteous, and in spite of a booking snafu, handled things efficiently, and professionally. I was upgraded to the large suite, which is only slightly more expensive to begin with.. and even at twice the price, the upgrade is well worth it. Honestly, spoil yourself a little. Breakfast was delicious, plentiful and varied each day. So nice to start the day by the lake on the golf course. It really set the tone each morning. The grounds are well kept, and the neighborhood is beautiful, quiet, and very, very safe. The downsides (which really had little impact on me) that everyone talks about are as follows: 1) It is difficult to find the place the first time, and for me, the second time. Once you get your bearings, all is good. I would suggest printing a Google Earth shot of the neighborhood before you leave for your trip. it will help. 2) It is a 20 minute walk to the commercial district and the beach. I liked the walk, and even lost 5 lbs on the trip, so I'm all for it, but I can see where people could get tired of it. I rented a car, and suggest you do, as well. Free parking on site. After spending 10 nights, I was so sad to leave. I walked into town (Playa Del Carmen) daily, and saw some beautiful hotels and complexes, but the noise, and crowds, for me, were a huge turn off. When I return to Playa, I have every intention of staying at the Hacienda Vista Royal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! A car is helpful and here are DIRECTIONS!”
Reviews.Author: ArtTeacherAmy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Playa Del Carmen and stayed 6 nights at the Hacienda Vista Real. We LOVED the hotel. It is SO quiet, I always slept well. Buffet breakfast was great, different everyday, eggs, potatoes, juice, toast, fruit, a mexican dish, coffee, tea. And eating by the pool and lake every morning in the warm sun was lovely. The beds were comfortable, rooms were big with high ceilings, granite tile bathroom, cavernous shower. I thought the staff was great, always friendly and ready to help. They give you fresh beach towels everyday and FREE water bottles. I suggest for $20 more a night upgrading to the larger suites, which we took a look at. We stayed in 2020 which had 2 double beds and a balcony overlooking the gardens (not a suite, just a room). The suites are HUGE; living room, dining room, full kitchen and bedroom. I would get one of these if we went back with our daughter. The place had a few families, but not a lot of kids running around. Mostly couples. Nice pool area too. Downsides: if you do not have a car ( I really suggest it! We saved a ton of money not buying tours of the ruins and the car was only $10 a day!) you will have to take taxis ($4-5) into town which is a 5 minute drive to 10th AVE which has all the shops and restaurants and nightclubs. You could walk into town, 20 mins. We walked 15 minutes to the beach one day, but I would not want to do that everyday. With a car you can drive to the different beaches, we had a great day snorkeling at Akumal ($12pp for mask and life jacket from Akumal Dive shop. $2 to park in lot across from it.) Other downside is finding this hotel! We got in at 11pm and drove around 30 minutes to find it! HERE ARE THE DIRECTIONS! TAKE the highway, 307 from Cancun airport south about 40 minutes to Playa Del Carmen that part is easy. Then as you come near the end of town, you can tell you are going to start heading into nowhere again, big sign for TULUM, you want to take a Retourno and head back NORTH on 307 STAY in the right 2 lanes. Then look for the HUGE PlayaCar sign in stone. You want to turn into the second one. (If you miss it take the road on the right by Holiday Inn.) The streets are not marked. Come past the security gate, and look for the hotel signs in the middle of the road. First right is for Vista Real and Pakal. Pass the OXXO, and look for the BIG PAKAL golf sign, it is BEHIND PAKAL. Of course we did not have a clue where this place was so we drove all over Playacar. OK, go through security gates of Pakal, and now head to the left as you drive down. Go all the way down and the hotel is at the end ( no sign! They need to put up a big sign!) Free parking in the lot. If you miss the Playacar entrance, take the street by Holiday Inn which goes all the way down, and then turn right into the Playacar development, and then another right by the traffic circle. Take that up.) We had a great time, we saw a lot with the car: Tulum, Coba ruins, Akumal beach, and snorkeling in a cenote and ziplining at AtkunChen. We went to the beachclub at PLaya Mamitas ( $40 pesos for a lounge with umbrella) but got there too late for one. And we drove into town everynight for dinner on 10th AVe. FOUND PARKING ON 20th AVE between 6th and 8thNorte everynight! We had great food on the Ave. Liked most restaurants we ate in. Lots of fun shops. Great place to visit. I heard Playa Del Carmen is better than Cancun. And one night we went out for a drink, stopped in Mandala ( says $12 cover but they let us in at 11.30pm free) and we went to the club across the street on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Two star...at best”
Reviews.Author: Davidsf2012
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night to fun a largely abandoned hotel at the end of a dead end street. When they gave us our room key, they said the room was 'downstairs', and showed us to our room. The room was musty, dark and smelled like mold was growing all over the walls. We requested extra pillows and they never arrived (despite being to the desk twice), and the overall service was poor. The location of the hotel is almost worse than the costumer service. Plan a good 30 min walk to get anywhere for dinner (btw, they don't have dinner at the hotel). Overall, a Motel 6 is cleaner, a Super 8 is friendlier and almost anything is more convenient than Hacienda Vista...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lisapammiepostle
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very clean and the staff are great nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfasts were a gd mixture of cereal, toast, fruit and typically Mexican food to choose from, so something for everyone. Maid service was regular and very efficient. If I was being really picky the ONLY thing I would recommend is that they offer a shuttle service to the beach as its a little out of the way and the walk is a bit of a chore in the heat but other than that it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and much needed tropical vacation-perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ladyplain
Reviews.Content: My friend from the West Coast and I (from the East Coast) met up in Playa del Carmen for a few days of beach, sunshine, and relaxation. Hacienda Real was the perfect place for this kind of trip. The location, while not ON the beach, was a little walk away. The beach had soft sand, an endless (rentable) lounge chairs, available food service delivery, and perfect water for lots of swimming. The hotel room was VERY comfortable and the perfect place to retire to for an afternoon nap: quiet, breezy (when you open the shuttered windows, which I loved!), with soft big beds. The location is perfect and right in the heart of things but not so much that any noise affected our stay. Our room was on the first floor facing the courtyard, with the pool (also awesome), and worked very well for what we needed. The rooftop deck had a great view of the ocean too! Also, the staff was consistently friendly and helpful with everything. Muchas gracias Hacienda Real!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Charm”
Reviews.Author: SnorklingBadger
Reviews.Content: We wanted an affordable (but still appealing) base camp for our snorkeling adventures. Playa del Carmen seemed to be a good central location but we didn’t want stay downtown or at a big, noisy resort. The Vista Real really fit the bill. The hotel sits on a large pond in the center of a golf course. After going through 2 security gates in the quiet golf resort community of Playacar, we felt extremely safe indeed! As you can see by some of the photos, the hotel oozes Olde World Mexican charm. We’re suckers for places with character and Vista has it in spades! There’s local flavor and detail around every corner. We chose the ambassador suite because of the full kitchen and the balcony views. It was a wonderful room and almost too much space for just two people. The kitchen could have been cleaner and wasn't exactly fully stocked but we enjoyed making our own fresh guacamole and preparing our lunches for the days’ outings. Per Mexican standards, the beds were very firm. We just borrowed the mattress from the sleeper couch in the living room and had great sleep. The hotel atmosphere was very calm and quiet. However, like many of the hotels and haciendas in Mexico, everything is made of colorful tile, stone, plaster and concrete that makes things “echo-y”. That’s part of the experience. The bathroom was quite small compared to the size of the suite, but the shower was huge and hot water was plentiful. Although some reviews complained of bugs, we did not have any problem. Perhaps having a garden-level room might add to the likelihood? And hey, this is the tropics! The in-room safe was easy to use and we left our passports and most of our cash there every day without worry. The breakfast buffet included in the price was better than I had hoped - lots of variety and freshly made right there in the outdoor kitchen by the pool. It definitely catered to more of the Latin/European tastes and there was plenty to choose from. We really looked forward to the quiet mornings eating outside and watching the ducks, coots, herons, and egrets around the pond. The grounds of the Vista are lovely and well-maintained. There is a Mayan-themed building attached to the hotel that used to be a spa back when the Vista was a time-share. (The main photo on this sight shows the old entrance with the large pool in front - it's now a garden area). The spa building is no longer in use, but it’s fun to look at! The staff were exceptional. We initially got a room on the ground floor, but asked to move to an upper room for better views and more privacy. No problem. The pool was cool, clean, and lovely. There is free internet for use in the soaring, palapa-roofed lobby. We never once saw a time-share shark. By car or taxi, downtown Playa del Carmen is just minutes away. A stroll will take you 25-30 minutes but it is very safe and quiet. We tried to drive once. If you’ve ever tried to drive in a Mexican city, (especially at night on the weekends) you’ll understand why we chose to walk instead! There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we never tried it. Right outside the first security gate there is a little mall with a convenience store (with an ATM) and several restaurants. On a couple of rainy nights, we drove there and had both excellent empanadas and thin-crust pizza. Once you figure it out, getting on to the main coastal highway 307 is very quick and easy. Driving south to Akumal or north to Puerto Morelos took only around 20 minutes. The Vista is not a 5-star, luxury hotel. It is a nod to the romantic elegance of a time gone by and the new owners seem to be trying to return it to its former glory. It would not be the ideal place for families with young children, party-ers, or beach bums. For our needs and travel style it worked very well. It was a lovely place to start and end our days. We also got a very good deal online that gave us all that quiet charm for the same price as a budget box hotel in the States! If we had to pay typical Mexican resort rates, I'd have found more to complain about. But for what we paid, the Vista Real definitely met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: b z
Reviews.Content: This place is super quiet and very low key. The property displays in person precisely as it appears on line. That was very impressive. The full kitchen did not have any pots and pans. We waited 2 days for the pots and pans to be delivered. Also no dish rags, towels or dish soap. Maid service cleans the dishes for a fee of $6.00. On day 3 we came home from being away overnight to find bugs crawling all over the pillows and up the wall (headboard) on both beds. After advising the front desk...someone came approximately 45 minutes later to inspect. This individual could not speak english and simpled brushed the bugs from the pillows onto the floor with her bare hands. She attempted to say the bugs were due to my sealed hand cream being place beside the bed...this container was with me on my overnighter and I had just placed it on the side table temporarily...when the discovery of bugs occured. We wanted to check out. The response was that we had to take it up with the travel agent as we had prepaid our room. We were offered another room....however it was still being cleaned and would be ready in 30 minutes. After waiting for 5 hours, I was not prepared to leave my belongings in a bug infested room, we were able to move to our new room. This was a complete waste of valuable travel time. Our new room did have a complete set of pots and pans AND a dishwasher with soap...no need to pay maid service for clean dishes. We checked out 2 nights early...again the front desk did not seem to care that we were unhappy. It was suggested we take it up with the travel agency. It would seem to me, that the hotel should be striving for a raving review for travel agents as the agents are the ones recommending their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Neelu M
Reviews.Content: Christian runs the breakfast buffet and his service and manners are impeccable. We were there three mornings for breakfast and we had a diff menu every morning, the hotel is a bit away from the main city but the location is beautiful, rooms are good and very clean. I loved my stay hear and would come back. The o ly negative is that there is no accessibility to the beach but you get a day pass to the Indigo beach club .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property away from downtown Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Marco9
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 3 days but for the most part a very nice experience. The staff was all very nice and helpful. The full breakfast in the morning was a nice bonus and never too busy. The pool was nice and got little use in fact after dinner we would usually be the only ones there. Past reviews have said it was a 15 minute walk to downtown but we're fairly quick walkers and it was 25 for us which is still not bad, it is a nice walk. We always took a cab home after a day at the beach for 70 peso's. The beach club is at Indigo Beach Club close to the Blue Parrot, this was available only after 10:30 though we were allowed in at 10:00 the first day which was a good thing cause it filled up quickly after that. The only problem was the rooms are not very soundproof at all, the people next door or in the hallways would be speaking in a normal voice and could be heard like they were in the same room, luckily we had good neighbours. I asked the front desk about this and he agreed it is sometimes a problem but most rooms were the same so no use in changing, also we found the beds very hard even for Mexico, overall I would still recomend this hotel and would stay again but would try and stay poolside

Reviews.Title: “A PEARL....”
Reviews.Author: globespun
Reviews.Content: This place is a perfect get away... Romantic as hell and quiet. Not a place for kids, 20 minute walk or a taxi for $7.00...... Super clean, safe!!!!! and great staff..... Not one complaint, it was amazing..... Not the center of action, so if you want to party till 4 stay downtown. Class and beauty.. Stay here.... We had a suite and it was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YES! BOOK THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Had everything but far from town”
Reviews.Author: escapingtherain
Reviews.Content: The hotel accomodation, staff and food was excellent. The only problem was the distance to town. If they sprung for a shuttle bus, it would have be perfect. (I do a lot of walking, but it's the heat that kills you). However, the walk is safe winding through a high end, gated residential area and golf course. I recommend a taxi in the evening back to the hotel, 70 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Devochka1267
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel sight unseen via Lastminutetravel.com 10 days before my trip. I was looking to get away solo to do some relaxing and resting. I wanted a well priced property that was central to attractions in town. I did not want an all inclusive and was not concerned with being beachfront. The hotel exceeded my expectations by far. As i checked in, I was given a small ground floor interior room with no outdoor space. I was very disappointed and returned to the front desk to ask for a change of rooms. They apologized and offered to move me to a larger room with private outdoor space right away. The updrade was free. I was given a 2000 square foot suite complete with a living room, dining room, full kitchen, washer and dryer, and 2 BR/2baths. The room faced the golf course. There were 2 patios and best of all, a small but private pool. The service at the hotel was top notch and a delicious buffet breakfast was included. Here are some additional pluses and minuses. + $6 taxi ride to town +totally secure with excellent security--2checkpoints +free wireless +International guests +No kids -- quiet and relaxing - Restaurant only open for breakfast and lunch -No store onsite -Spa was closed -Jacuzzi was broken

Reviews.Title: “Bugs! Breakfast and Feels Abandoned”
Reviews.Author: pmonty1
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very helpful and friendly, esp Nancy at the front desk! She went beyond for me. The included breakfast buffet is good...better then a continental breaky but no huevos! And if you are going on an excursion for the day they won't make you an early boxed lunch which means you miss breakfast as it doesn't start until 730 am. The hotel is a 20 min walk from town and from the beach. If you are looking for something quiet and relaxing or if you're going to golf this would suit you fine. For people looking for a bit more excitement and energy it's kinda slow. The hotel feels abandoned as no one uses the pool! The pool bar is NEVER open and there is no food available for guests anytime after breaky. You can ask for a coffee maker for your room but you are not allowed to take coffee or tea from the buffet and nothing is available in the lobby. My room was big and just off the pool with its own patio which was nice, however....bugs!!! These little garden bugs were all over my room and I ended up with bites all over my wrists, ankles and yes even on my forehead! Not good. There was no hot water. Housekeeping didn't replenish my towels. And phone calls, even to local numbers are VERY expensive! I learned this the hard way. Not the best place for a solo traveler. Id recommend it for couples or big groups but apart from that there isn't anything going on here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: duffyreef
Reviews.Content: This was our 17th trip to the Rivera Maya and first trip booked through Orbitz. Our trip was 3/24-3/31/11. We have stayed at many A/I and also have rented private condos throughout our travels to the area. The Hacienda was just perfect for us. Although there are not many amenities the Complimentary Breakfast was excellent. We stayed in the Ambassador Suite. The room was well equipped. Just a 15 minute walk to the beach and 5th Ave. This hotel was Excellent for the price that we paid through Orbitz. We would be happy to answer any ?’s

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrentonPh
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at the Hacienda Vista Real, although we have stayed at other places in Playacar. It turned out to be a great experience for all of us - a group of about 20. This is a really nice and fancy place to stay! We greatly enjoyed its tranquility, the cordial manner of the workers, and how comfortable we were. We definitely have it in our plans to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Clean, wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very pleased with the overall accomodations and experience. It is a smaller hotel and very intimate feeling. The only negative was the typical sales pitch that you receive several times during your stay trying to sell you a timeshare, but it was beautiful and a small inconvenience in the long run. Would absolutely go back at the first opportunity. Great for couples or families with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: jose5454
Reviews.Content: Go and enjoy in this wonderful place..... Too quiet. Very nice and friendly staff. Needs maintenance in some areas (gym, spa, lobby). Special architectural style.

Reviews.Title: “30th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: lazybeacher
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a great deal on a hotel when I found this hotel thru Bestfares. I already knew we would have a rent car, and the photos online showed a lovely hotel. This is by far the best deal in Playa del Carmen. I knew its location inside Playa Car and studied the google map so I was able to drive right to the front entrance of the hotel with no problems. The staff is very personable and caring. The room was just lovely. 2 queen size beds overlooking the pool. A/C was great. If you are an independent type of traveller, like to have a rent car, go out for lunch and dinner and eat breakfast at your hotel, this will be a great home base to discover Playa del Carmen. The hotel is like a hacienda. Just big enough to have lovely grounds, pool and entrance, yet small enough to feel like you are at someones personal hacienda. We enjoyed the buffet each morning served around the pool area, and explored all day to return to the pool to refresh ourselves before going out again. The hotel sits inside a 2nd gaurded gate entrance inside Playa Car. We felt very safe, enough to stroll in the evenings way after dark. The corner stores provide several types of quick foods, a convienence store, laundry, and hair salon. We used all the stores while at the hotel. Easy in and out. The grounds of the hotel are amazing, photos do not do it justice. It is true some of the "normal" hotel things are lacking, however, we did not miss any of it. For example, no bar. We are not drinkers so it did not matter to us. The restaurant closes at 3 each day, not a problem for us, we left early and ate out each day. The staff makes up for anything you might think you need by just asking. A point that someone might find useful is that parking is very close to the lobby, and easy to get to your room and pool without walking forever. The rooms are designed so that you can have a 3 bedroom villa with a full service kitchen in your room. The rooms have separate entrances, and a large family gathering would be ideal here. We stayed 11 nights, and I wish I could have stayed forever. Go down and enjoy Mexico, the good prices and deals will not last forever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Mexican Hotel....Peaceful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: wripp86
Reviews.Content: After booking The Hacienda Vista Real on Priceline.com and reading the reviews, I was very concerned about the place. There were some strange issues on the hotel grounds which I will mention, but this place was so beautiful and peaceful that I came home missing it. The staff is very nice and friendly. The strange issues would be the hot tub--- they have a huge hot tub that is filled with water but no jets running and when we asked they said it didn't work. When I asked about the gym, she said it was over in the spa area (which is closed down) and she also said there was no air conditioning at the gym. We walked over to see it and found it upstairs...it was so hot we would have passed out from the heat within minutes so we kept exploring the Spa area. On the rooftop we found a beautiful pool (clean and full of water) not being used by anyone (weird). The breakfast buffet wasn't the best food ever but it's free and that was a nice surprise to us ~ they had a lot of food to choose from for a free buffet. It seemed odd that the bar was only open til 3pm but you learn to survive :) ~ buy a six pack and keep it in your room fridge! The air conditioning was okay but could have been a little cooler. The pool is perfect and very relaxing ~ since there are not hundreds of people staying here, you will have the pool to yourself a lot of the time. I took hundreds of photos of the place. I was grateful that they allow you to print your plane tickets before you leave...it's just nicer than the huge resorts for many reasons like that. All of the workers were friendly. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby area. We found that in the heat, it was much better to get a cab than walk. We took a cab at least once a day.....it's a quick trip and well worth it.---Just a little inconvenient at times. I think that the peace and quiet of this hotel is what makes it a very special hotel that you can truly relax at. I loved the Mexican ambiance of the place.

Reviews.Title: “super choice for a combo vacation of serenity and accessibility to the fun stuff in the area”
Reviews.Author: goodtime4
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a week of vacation in Mexico with my husband and our two precious young adult children. This is literally our best experience at a resort in years: I especially enjoy the CLEAN, safe, serene and eco friendly setting, and the way that they start our day with a healthy and festive breakfast and a swim that feels as if we are having a semi private pool party. The staff has been extremely efficient, effective and graceful in responding to our needs, whether it is to arrange the taxi to take us to the airport to catch our flight at 6 a.m. or giving us a pot to make boiling water (in addition to the complimentary bottled water that are readily available). The resort is within 15 minutes of walking distance from the hub of Playa del Carmen's ferry, beach, shopping (even where the local go), eateries and bus terminal to all the "hot" spots for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret In Playa del Carmen!!”
Reviews.Author: OSCALGOR
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is right at the best area of "Playa Car" (country club) is located only 20 minutes walk from the famous fifth avenue or you can get a cab to get there in 5 minutes. This is a place to relax, unwind and have a real rest of the busy life form the cities. The rooms are the best clean, confortable and luxurious. The bed you will think you are sleeping on a cloud. The service is great and they just have a few peopl on their staff. The food is good. From the pool you can see the golf course and an exotic landscape. And the very best the rate!! you will pay the half of the price you should be paying We are going back for sure

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - pictures on site not of actual hotel”
Reviews.Author: crittle3
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean, but location is not close enough to beach and is about a 20 minute walk into downtown Playa. breakfast was very good, however. pictures posted on trip advisor are not of the actual hotel - only about 30% of them. there is only one small pool next to a lake on the golf course and it is swarming with birds. cordial staff and quiet rooms. area in playacar is secluded and feels safer than being downtown. overall a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “waylyn minnesota”
Reviews.Author: skinhead7149
Reviews.Content: the hotlel was great fantastic rooms staff was superb and the breakfast bufffett was excellent. i would recommend this hotel resort for any anyone i would like to stay there again had a very nice experience very private and quiet well done staff

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for an Amazing Price, and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: grey0806
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a modest hotel due to the price that we payed for it. Since the very first moment we saw the Spa we new that all our expectations were wrong. The hotel was much much better than just a modest hotel. It has a wonderful staff, the location is perfect if you just want to scape from the crowded area of 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen. The hotel was clean, and we even had a balcony in our room for the basic price. The friends that were traveling with us got a room with a Jacuzzi for the same price that we payed for ours. All the rooms don't have the same size or style. It is kind of hard to find the hotel the first time, but it is located 20 min walking from 5th Avenue which is the main street in Playa del Carmen. I would definitely return to this hotel. It was a great experience for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful , safe , Mexican home away from home !”
Reviews.Author: osakismn
Reviews.Content: I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the Hacienda Vista Real .... with word of safety issues for tourists in several parts of Mexico it was wonderful to know that we were staying in a "gated community " .....never once did I feel unsafe walking to or from town . It was my impression that the 20-25 minute walk to town or the beach was a bonus .... you have a safe and quiet place to sleep .....never a guarantee when you stay near the beach and nightclub scene ! Some reviews have mentioned not having patio furniture or cooking items ......I wonder if they ever asked for these items of the resort staff ? We were given everything we asked for to address kitchen / cooking needs as well as patio furniture for our all important morning coffee on the patio ! If you enjoy a beautiful , quiet place to stay and like a short walk when you feel like the beach , shopping on 5 th Ave. , etc. this is the perfect option for you ! The staff is wonderful and assisted up in finding connections with tours , reccomending restaurants , assuring that our transport was available for airport connection , etc...... They are happy to provide you with purified water at all times of the day . I've only been home ( MN ) for a week , and I'm already "homesick" for my Mexican home away from home !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and public areas inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: stlouiewoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite, lots of space nice kitchen ,full size frig, microwave and gas stove but very little needed equipment. Don't plan to do any cooking here.also had a lovely large balcony but no outdoor furniture. Hotel provides a great buffet breakfast and has a small restaurant which is open until 3pm. We did not eat there for brkft and could not find a lunch menu. It is a 20 minute walk to town. Hotel has arrangements with a public beach to provide guests with beach chairs but it is a $7 taxi ride to the beach. The hotel has a nice pool and is on a golf course. The large spa next door is closed. The whirlpool tubs do not whirl or heat. It is a lovely property at a reasonable cost but it is hard to decide if it is being well maintained

Reviews.Title: “First honeymoon after 13 years!”
Reviews.Author: Chofis
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for the price..However I was kind of apprehensive after making the reservations and reading all reviews...and boy was I wrong...We are not the "all inclusive" type. We like to eat at different restaurants, visit different beaches, meet people and get the feeling of the city. Also we don't stay at the hotel all day...there are too many things to see and do. Although it was so nice we probably could have!! If you feel the same, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU! Breakfast was very good and the surroundings were wonderful and romantic! The golf course and the pond are adjacent to the pool area of the hotel with turtles and ducks... The location is very very classy, clean and safe, which is all important to us. The hotel is located at the end of a private subdivision and you are let in by a guard at the gate. There is a winding cobble stone road that leads you to the hotel. The spa service was closed because of the "slow season"..but there are plenty of places located elsewhere. Ohh and the staff were so accommodating and kind! We were thrilled with our stay at Hacienda Vista Real and would stay there again!! Maybe I shouldn't be so honest because I want to make sure the rooms aren't booked next year when I go back!!!! We choose to rent a car and Im not sure if it was worth it...during our visit (in the not so busy season) it was about 150.00 usd for 6 days and about 5 usd taxi ride into the city...but FYI you DO have to pay for parking downtown or at the beach which was about 2 usd per hour or 10 for 24hr period. And of course if your drinking a taxi may be safer..

Reviews.Title: “VALUE But not the place to be without a car, and even with a car it is a challange.”
Reviews.Author: fdoamerica
Reviews.Content: Those reviews (read below) that carp about how hard it is to find the hotel (without a taxi) are "spot on". It took me an hour to drive from Cancun to Playa de Carmen and another 40 minutes to find this hotel... Also, it is not close to the beach, that said, it is a wonderful hotel with clean, large rooms and a limited, but helpful staff. If you book through the internet and get a room under $89 a night, they might put you in a room in the interior of the hotel. But, if you complain, and if they are not full, they will move you to a room with a window or even a room with a balcony. There is no dining at the hotel in the evening but there are four small restaurants within walking distance. Their breakfast is excellent, served by the pool. The hotel is a find if you can find it. :) Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One man's reject could be a treasure to you..."”
Reviews.Author: VadimFromArkansas
Reviews.Content: I think you need to really understand what you are looking for before deciding whether this hotel is a place you want to visit. Those who envisioned it as a luxury resort on a golf course and a spa, obviously have not reached that goal. However, I have not seen the entire place, every room, so my impression may be biased. My room (Imperial 302-1) was a Super Value at Orbitz. Booked for just $72 it was worth at least a couple hundreds dollars if it was at a hotel at a good location. Large room with marble flooring, heavy wooden doors, dome ceiling made of bricks, good linens, and other luxury attributes were a nice surprise. Complementary breakfast could compete with what you may expect at a luxury hotel. But here come some but(s). As some people have mentioned, the place feels empty. There were guests checking in, but there was no activity for them besides the computer with Internet in the lobby that would keep them around after breakfast. Located at the end of a gated residential area, it has no entertainment near by, so you either walk about 15-20 min to Playa del Carmen or ride a taxi for about $5 to get there. The building next to the hotel, the spa, is not functioning for the primary purpose. Some areas in the hotel show a sign of neglect, but they are a bit off sight. So, if you like to get better room for less, like to play golf and have access to the course nearby, do not mind getting out for dinner and seeing some neglectaway from the main path, you should like it. I met someone who has rented a scooter so he and his wife could ride to the beach so that he would not have to carry his kite surfing equipment. He liked the deal as staying on the beach would be too costly. We stayed one night because we arrived one day early due to a coming winter storm at where we live and needed a place to stay. I thought it was a great deal for what we were looking for. Would I stay there for my entire vacation? No – we had a child with us and being away from a beach would be too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Camipot
Reviews.Content: The place was amazing, the staff super friendly, nice breakfast, great rooms, parking lot, inside of Playacar. I loved this place, it is not an all inclusive but it is a super nice place where to stay if you're in a tight budget. We actually had a reservation for a tiny little room and they gave us an executive suite, it was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “First bad room through Priceline...would definitely not return”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtheworld200
Reviews.Content: To start on a positive note. The property is actually quite beautiful and located on a golf course if that is what you are into. The reception area is huge and open air which is what I like. The second room I got (first room I refused to sleep in) had comfortable beds and a nice large patio area. As an independent backpacker on this trip, I cannot state how bad the location is if you don't have a car. I took a bus from Tulum and they dropped me off at Playacar. With backpack on my back I approached security and they had me walk literally two hours in the wrong direction. I then had to get a taxi to go in the other direction. To walk into Playa del Carmen proper it will take you about 30-40 minutes and I walk at a fast clip even with a major backpack on. This started my experience off on a very poor note. The hotel is actually located at the end of a residential area thus I was passing kids playing outside and neighbors socializing. This is not what I wanted from my stay in Playa del Carmen. The hotel was extremely isolated from anything else thus I had to take taxis back and forth into town at 10us per trip. Upon checking in the guy tried giving me the room behind the front desk. The room had no windows and smelled of mildew like you would not believe. I refused to stay in the room and almost left without even asking for a refund. When I asked for a different room he said they were filled but that was that a blatant lie as I was on the internet that afternoon and saw they had plenty of rooms. In the end, there may have only been a few people staying at the place while I was there. There were only a couple of cars in the overnight parking which I assumed were the employees cars. The breakfast buffet was great as long as you didn't order eggs from the 'chef'. He mixed up my order two mornings in a row and on the third morning I decided I would just go with the buffet eggs instead of fresh ones. The staff stood around talking and were basically not doing anything with people sitting with empty dishes in front of them or tables with empty dishes where people had left. The breakfast buffet staff were the epitome of what one does not want in a restaurant or in the service industry. The man that checked me in at the front desk who lied to me about them being filled was actually quite accommodating as I was in a very foul mood after having walked so much and finding the hotel was so far in the middle of nowhere. The wifi did not work in the rooms thus one has to go into the lobby. Even the lobby for 2 of the 3 days didn't have it thus you have to use their old desktop. A very nice property but without people around it was somewhat haunting. The rooms were decorated in a style I would associated with the a 1950's Las Vegas hotel. Very cheap furniture/furnishings/television. The bathroom was large and very well appointed. I got the room for 60US per night which i think is worth it only if you have a room with a patio, if you are looking for peace and solitude, you have your own car to get into town, and you are sharing it with someone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quaint”
Reviews.Author: Michiepoo
Reviews.Content: My parents as well as my sis, her hubby and me and my hubby.... all loved this place. It's not a large resort, but it has all the amenities you'll need. The rooms were very spacious and clean and there was a full kitchen for use. The art and decorations and grounds are gorgeous. It feels very authentic. Loved the morning breakfast right beside the pool, which was included. It was buffet style but had a wide selection. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The spa was beautiful too, but could have used a little updating. I really wish we could have stayed longer. It's very quiet, definitely not a party place. I would say it's perfect for a couple that wants a romantic getaway. Don't order pizza from pizza hut... cost over $40 for 2 med size pizza's to be delivered, but we weren't sure what restaurant to trust. There is a small pizza place just a 2 min walk outside the resort that has great food, as well an awesome little mexican restaurant with great quesadillas and a corner store with cheap beer. I have only 2 small complaints... 1) being that at night (and only at night) there seemed to be a bit of a sewage smell in the bathroom and 2) they used to have a shuttle to the beach under old management but do not have that anymore... this would have definitely being a major plus. I would absolutely go back to this place. The walk to the beach is only about 15 min and it's in a gated community with beautiful scenery and people out walking and exercising. Taxi about $5 USD. Only 10 min to walk into the town of playa del carmen. And FYI buy all your booze and groceries right in town at Walmart - about $10 - $12 for a huge bottle of Jose Cuervo. This area (playa del carmen) has so many busy, crowded resorts that we have been too several times... but this place was by far the perfect, quiet, hideaway, gem we were looking for. We will absolutely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not dissapointed but wouldnt go back. Not what I expected from Playa del carmen but it was fairly cheap and VERY quiet.”
Reviews.Author: lesliediann
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to mexico and my first to playa del carmen. After visiting Playa del Carmen, I am actually pleased that we DID NOT stay in the town on playa del carmen. Small, authentic, quiet and interesting were the descriptions I had heard from most reviews and people I know who had been but this was before it had turned into a tackier, cheesy,dirty downtown cancun. The hotel was decent, clean and quiet. In fact we were the ONLY PEOPLE STAYING AT THE HOTEL! 4th of july weekend and noone around?? strange...There was also No spa to use which was disappointing. We upgraded our studio room for another $150 because it was 3 times the size, had 4 balconies and pool/lake/gold course views. I didnt expect to be so far from the beach and I was not even informed of the other vista real hotels and beach clubs until the last day from the taxi driver. Out of the way, 20-25 min walk from town and then a further walk through screaming, annoying locals begging to check out their blankets, jewelry and other crap. The hotel food was rediculous. No menu and noone to tell you what there is to eat, I asked for french toast or pancakes and was given a basket of stale bread. Our package offered us an american breakfast but that was just a slice of fruit and whatever they felt like making, NO BUFFET...make sure you know before you book this hotel, there is no buffet, no menus and little food to choose from on the lunch menu which is only available for a few hours. There is a cafe right outside of the community on the left that has AWESOME food for a decent price. Nice place to stay but realize, it is not a beach vacation! You will also spend 5 bucks everytime you go in and out of the community on a cab...not much money but 4 times a day for 5 days gets to be a little much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, slightly corporate feel”
Reviews.Author: jerryjcim
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and mediterranean architecture is beautiful (but a little bit lacking in charm because it was so well kept) and we found a great deal on hotels.com Internet sucks: don't expect it to work I'm very particular about clean sheets, and this hotel was very clean. Just a block away from the main strip, which is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dani_verastegui
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, great staff. Only down side is that it is a little ways from Playa del Carmen, but it is still walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “HVR are thiefs, they rip their customers off and don't refund money”
Reviews.Author: ccpresh
Reviews.Content: I canceled with them and they had $3,500 on my credit card and would not credit my account. I went to the councel and they told me that I had to get a Mexican lawyer. I canceled within the allotted time and nobody at HVR would even talk to me. I will never go to Mexico again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pretty, unique, off the beaten path in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: CincyOHTraveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel quite a bit, as a relaxing, quiet and pretty place to be for 5 days. It is in the Playacar development, tucked into a quiet part next to the golf course. The pool area is attrative, with ponds and golf course beyond. The pool deck area is used for the delicious buffet breakfast each morning, which was included. The food selection is slanted toward a more Mexican offering, with plenty of options. It is not a short walk to either the town/5th Avenue or to the beach, although we did walk quite a few times (about 15-20 minutes each way). Cabs are easy - we had a rental car. Bikes are not available to rent, as hard as we tried to find them in Playa Del Carmen! Free wireless in the lobby, not available in the rooms. As long as you are ok with what it doesn't offer, I recommend it as a place to relax and a base for your various activities in and around the Maya Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: camelbreath
Reviews.Content: we stayed here just for one night toward the end of our trip and was surprisingly impressed by the location and the facility. it is tucked away in a private gated community in playacar/gold course. not a lot of traffic, quiet, and the hotel was great. we booked a studio special but b/c they did not have our room, we were upgraded to a suite - which we did not mind at all. room was clean, comfortable, and big. they also have a three story spa for $15 which we were looking forward to enjoying but found out that it is closed on sundays. :( this place is located little bit away from the beach so if looking for a easy access, not an ideal place. but great for people who have a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: RedSunTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel for 2 days . We got a good deal from Hotwire. Rooms are spacious , clean , great king bed , little on the "dark side" but we were out all day anyways. Good breakfast. Each day different food was served. Staff friendly and helpful ( they found out car keys we lost in the lobby ). We had a rental car therefore had no issues with walking. It is nice , new , clean and safe neighborhood ...Good deal for the money. If you are looking for Ritz Carlton then look some other place. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the cost..or even free!”
Reviews.Author: arobin
Reviews.Content: I rarely write a negative review as I believe that most things that are bad that I experience are just deviations from a good hotels norm. THIS location, however, is different. First, the initial room we were given had one window that let in NO light. Literally, with the lights off in the middle of the day it is BLACK. After discussing my concern with the front desk (and having them tell me there is nothing they can do for me today unless we want to pay extra for a suite upgrade- unapologetic staff was the norm here), we stayed there for the first night (of 4). We went to sleep at around 10 or 11 and were woken up at midnight when our neighbors returned for the night. I would have been annoyed at them had they been screaming or doing something terribly disruptive. Sadly, they were just talking in their room and due to the terrible (lack of) sound insulation it sounded like they were sitting on my bed talking to me. I could have easily taken part in their conversation without moving. SO- the next day we got moved to the one studio room with a sliding door (that did not lock properly!!! but we picked our battles). Yes, the lighting was better but you give up the spa tub in this room. That night, all of a sudden it smelled like someone was smoking in our room. It turned out that was due to the 2inch gap around the door between our room and the adjoining room. When we asked to be put in any room where there was no adjoining room no matter what the price (this was after two terrible nights sleep due to neighbor noise) they told us that ALL rooms have adjoining rooms. I suppose if you are traveling with friends this is not a terrible problem BUT for us, it was a deal breaker. If you are a light sleeper at all, BRING EAR PLUGS. Really!!! On the positive (not that this mattered as the BONES of the place ruined our stay), the breakfast was nice and the walk that people complained about is really not that bad. The weather is generally great and its an easy walk 15-20 minutes max to the start of downtown. For golfers, I would imagine there are still better options out there but it would be convenient. summary- if you value a good nights sleep, good service, and airy rooms AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Location Makes this One a Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaTraveler3
Reviews.Content: I got this room for 2 nigths at the end of a business trip to Merida. I wanted a place for a couple of nights rest and beach before heading back to Alaska. To get to this hotel you have to take 1 1/2 hour bus and then a 5 dollar taxi. To walk to Playa takes 25 minutes. The staff tries to make it sound like its just around the corner. NOT TRUE. I was given a room that's about as big as a shoebox and one window looks out on a wall. The door to the room is not plumb and light shines through all around. They serve breakfast but no other food is available and the nearest store for even water is, again, quite a hike. Do not stay here if you want convience or ease and plan to spend extra $$ on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff poor management”
Reviews.Author: kevricco
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. My wife and I decided on the Vista Real for our honeymoon. The promise of a private beach club, and free shuttle to and from was a major reason for our decision, since the hotel is not on the beach. However when we arrived the hotel had just been sold, actually it was being sold right before our eyes. We saw both the owners (new and old) finalizing the deal. The beach as it turned out was not part of the deal. Under the new owner's command the management showed us no sympathy nor would they negotiate anything to make the situation right. We ate at the outside restraunt the vast majority of our stay, the food was very good and the staff was wonderfull. The change in ownership had the staff just as worried as we were upset. Because of the timing of our trip I cannot recomend this hotel. I fear that the staff that was there was not retained or they were not treated right and found other employement. And they were the only highlight of our stay. Bottomline; no beach, bad ownership, $5-10 cab ride to anything, nice spa, nice golf course, small rooms unless you get a suite. Probably a better value out there

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad (for us)”
Reviews.Author: upsetinplaya
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 days in the high season.the hotel was very clean and we had a nice room after we complained about the first one. The bed was excellent. the staff was nice and the breakfast buffet was very good and included. i liked the feel of the hotel on the inside kind of like a old hacienda. we didnt like the location...there was no shuttle to the beach and it is either a 1-2 mile walk or a cab ride. we dont golf but if you do its on top of a nice golf course. it was too isolated for us. the pool area was pleasant but the pool was small. the SPA cost an extra 15.00 a day per person and didnt look worth it...it was huge, but most of the water areas were in separated male-female areas and they were indoors with no windows. we found one mineral jacuzzi upstairs but it didnt seem worth the money for that. the SPA was very empty, too empty. i would only recommend this hotel to a golfer who liked ALOT OF QUIET.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Not close to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: fxitmn
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful place to stay if you don't mind being a 10 minute drive from the beach. It difficult to find the place in a very secure part of the residential area of Playa, not Playa Del Carmen! There is a great golf course on site and fantastic pools, spas, saunas and restaurant here. Amazing to me that they don't even have a map of where they are on their website. They recently changed management, maybe they can do a little better on that.

Reviews.Title: “Pool, gym, spa, and A/C - perfect way to end a vacation”
Reviews.Author: taffystay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first four nights of our vacation in a rustic, peaceful cabana in Tulum where we nursed sunburns. Unfortunately, with very little breeze and a lot of sand and salty ocean air everywhere, we were ready to feel clean and cool by the end of the week. We logged online in an Internet cafe and got a room at Hacienda Vista Real that cost even less than our cabana! When we arrived at HVR, we were pleasantly surprised. The room had A/C which was really all we wanted, but the spa/gym was amazing. We worked out and then lounged around on the rooftop pool and in the Jacuzzis in the "locker room." We also enjoyed the Jacuzzi outside. The whole place was so empty, and we saw maybe 4 other guests during our stay there. My only complaint was that the food service was slow. Our breakfast (room service) of just cereal and some pastries took about 25 minutes to arrive. But otherwise, it was a great way to end our vacation based on the things that really mattered to us! Also, if you're looking for a place right off of 5th Avenue, this is not the place. But it just takes less than 10 minutes to drive there.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: LauriePlano_TX
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel! It is not close to anything. In fact, the taxi driver could not even find the place. We started the check-in process only to find out that the hotel had been sold recently and no longer had beach access or a beach club. The hotel seemed deserted and did not see any other guests. One highlight is that they do offer free internet connection, so we were able to use our laptop in the lobby to find another hotel! Also note that it took about 30 minutes just to get a taxi to come and get us out of this place. The hotel charged us a one-night stay penalty for canceling, but it was worth not having to stay there. We found a much better deal in town, which was close to everything and had access to a very nice beach club just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble with reservation”
Reviews.Author: craigvu
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the hotel area is absolutely beautiful, and if you want a nice area to stay out of the hustle and bustle of Playa Del Carmen and 5th Ave, this is a good pick. However, upon arrival on the first night of our honeymoon we found that they did not receive our reservation from a 3rd party travel site. What a shock! In all fairness they did resolve the situation and found a room for us after a couple of hours, but it was not a simple process. If you're staying here please confirm the reservation ahead of time, and if i went back, I'd book directly through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asanfranciscogal
Reviews.Content: No wonder this was one of the only hotels with availabilities on Dec 30/31... First of all, this hotel is not in downtown Playa. Not that it mattered to us, we don't mind having to take a cab to go to the city. When we saw our room we freaked out: basically, half of the hotel rooms (those that are not facing the pool) have only two tiny windows of 5 inches by 15 inches facing a walkway, and one window facing the adjacent room's wall. This means that it is always gloomy in your room and have to turn the lights on during daylight. Second, the paint was coming out of our bathroom ceiling, leaving white chips on the floor. While we were showering, the damp made it worse and we would have paint fall on our heads. The worst part was when we enterred the room, there was an awful smell... like ultra humid and stinky. The manager recognized this smell was not normal, but she just said that it was due to the fact that so little air comes in the room, as their ventilation system does not work properly in that room. We told them they should change our room, but she said they were booked (then why the heck are they selling this room?). But she said she would do something about it. She called a house keeper, told us to wait in the lobby. We came back 20 minutes later, the house keeper had spilled all over the floor and in the bathroom this artificial cinammon oil meant to camouflage the smell - but she had put so much the whole place was even worse and it was hard to breathe because of the chemicals! So then we had to bring in extra fans to fan the place for 2 hours - and try to get this awful cinammon smell out. We finally managed to get the smell out and go to bed. The next day they put us in another room that was ok (no smell) - but the windows were still tiny. During the entire evening the person on duty hardly spoke english and told us she didn't have the manager's number. I will never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Jakse
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the world for years and never have I stayed at such at terrible hotel. Everything, and I meen everything, you can possible imagine was wrong. When I arrived they did not know i was comming so I had to waity 3 hours to get a room. When I finally got it the room was not cleaned. While they cleaned it they sent me to the pool, where there had no more towells. They did not hav a chair for me eather so I sat on the concret for 2 hours before my room was ready. The aircondition did not work and when I wanted to go to the beach I found out they did not have a beach any more. Food and drinks was bad and very slow, and when bill came it was totally messed up with things i did not order. Plastic was floating in the pool. There where no lighting in the hall ways and no room nombers on the doors and when I asked which room I was staying in since I forgot they did not know. Satelite signal was broken for the hole hotel the hole stay and when I came to my room at midnight to go to bed I found out that the door from the room to the garden could not lock so I had to stay awayke for 1 hour in order for them to fix it. Room service never showed up when I called them, Towells where dirty, and most the staff did not speake english. This was all only on the first day. The next day it all continued so i finally thought I was on hidden camera or something. My room was never cleaned, beds was the hardest I tried in a hotel and so on and so on. But worste of all the staff was ingnorant, arrogant and unfriendly. PLEASE NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: PhotoNYC
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda Vista Real was absolutely horrible!!!! From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. We booked this hotel through RCI (time share exchange) through this service we were required to purchase the all inclusive meal plan which was more then disappointing and a complete waist of money. Upon arriving at the hotel you enter a gated residential neighborhood and when you approach the hotel it looks absolutely beautiful..... Unfortunately this is where it stops. When checking in, the hotel had messed up all the rooms. After an hour of figuring everything out we were taken to our rooms. One room was a 2 bedroom suite that was very spacious and somewhat nice until we went into the back bedrooms that smelt so terribly of mildew it was hard to imagine sleeping there. After getting over the smell we realized that the windows are directly off the lobby so you can hear the staff and all the people milling through the lobby every 15 min. it sounded like some drunk teenager just walked into your room. After checking in we went down to the pool cafe and and had some drinks and appetizers. The drinks were weak.... so weak we had to order extra shots on the side and add them ourselves. When the food arrived (Nachos, tacos, ceviche, guacomole) it was tasteless and terrible. The ceviche was made of frozen fish and smelt terrible we could not eat it. After the drinks and appetizers we headed up to Jazmin the fine dining restaurant. We were very excited to eat hear as the other revues raved about the food. Entering a very beautifully designed restaurant I was excited until the food came. We could not imagine the food being any worse then the pool cafe, we were wrong! I ordered seared yellowtail which later led to food poisening that evening. All 8 of us could not finish our food or take more then one bite. After a uncomfortable night sleep in rock hard beds we were ready to soak up the sun and swim in the caribbean ocean. The hotel said they have a beach club a short shuttle ride away that offered towels, lounge, chairs a restaurant and a bar with service. When we inquired about the beach club they told us the shuttle only runs twice a day and that there is no beach club or food but they would provided us with drinks and a lunch box. Before heading to the beach the front desk informed us that there is no lunch boxes but they will provide us with drinks. We headed out on what was suppost to be a 15 min shuttle ride that ended up to be 45 min. long trip almost to Tulum. The beach was stunning but with no food and only two 2 liter bottles of coke and some cups provided it was unbelievable and really ruined the beach day. A long story short the service the location and the food were terrible. I have never ever stayed at a place this terrible and it was so bad it almost ruined our trip. I strongly advise you to never consider staying here as they completely misrepresent what they are about. As for Playa Del Carmen it is amazing! Gorgeous beaches great food and a very quaint european seaside town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel with an amazing spa”
Reviews.Author: closacco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Vista Real on our first trip to Mexico this July/August, and it was the perfect hotel for us. We were looking for something that was smaller than an all-inclusive mega resort but just as luxurious, and this hotel doesn't disappoint. The spa next door, which you get free access to when staying at the hotel, is gorgeous. It has 3 floors of relaxing rooms, and a full gym. They also offer spa treatments for an extra price (well worth it!). The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The hotel room was small, and without windows, but still very nice and good for us, as we were out and about most days. Both restaurants had excellent food, especially the smaller restaurant in the back near the pool, which was really nice and had excellent breakfast. And the hotel is a short 20 minute walk to downtown Playa and 5th Ave. Great staff, great hotel and great spa. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lied Multiple Times”
Reviews.Author: u0492600
Reviews.Content: A vendor at the airport encouraged us to visit the hotel for a condo talk and the coupon guaranteed a minimium of 90 minutes and money towards our car rental. However, when we produced the information, they took it from us and would not give it back. They looked us in the eye and said if we only planned on staying for the 90 minutes they wouldn't be able to give us the promised money. In fact, they couldn't give us the money towards our car rental as we were promised. Instead, we could buy tours from them and they would give us marginal discounts off the tours. They picked us up at our hotel, but dropped us off a half mile away. The lobby was hot and not air conditioned in any way. 1/10 people we talked to at the hotel could speak English with any real facility. Seriously, consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Food at an alll inclusive hotel”
Reviews.Author: gringo1974
Reviews.Content: Recently we had our wedding reception at the Hacienda Vista Real, and had over 20 guests stay at the hotel. All our guests and including my wife and me loved the facilities, the rooms, and the service. This hotel also had an incredible spa, and beach spot. The thing that seperated the Hacienda from other all inclusive my family and friends have stayed at was the quality of the food. When going to an all inclusive you are not expecting much from the hotel, but the food was incredible. I know my family and friends will be back that the Hacienda, and I recommended this hotel to anyone who is looking to get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler4874
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively for many years and this hotel- resort and spa was the most beautiful ever!!! In fact, it was not until the van drove up to the resort and I walked in did I realize that this was going to be paradise. The style wa typically Mexican and the lobby with its pictures and gorgeous interior made it so special. The staff was very friendly and easy to communicate with. Although I speak the language, it did not matter. They were wonderful. After my luggage was brought to my room, the vacation began. The highlights - Excellent service in the restaurants and I was thrilled to provide them with appropriate gratuity. They were friendly and a lot of fun. The rooms - always clean and you were given bottled water and lotions or shampoos when needed. transportation - the beach access and downtown taxis were available when needed. The walk downtown is about 15 minutes but taxis are always available. The food - Everything was very good and made as ordered. The staff enjoys making special cocktails and welcoming drinks. I am looking forward to seeing them again soon. The spa - Now that's paradise - just walk in and you will feel and smell the peace and tranquility. I used the services and it was well worth it !!! I enjoyed walking around to take pictures and tour the building. There's a restaurant upstairs and a pool for enjoying the sun and looking at the views. The private beach - the ride is about 20 minutes and the beach is gorgeous - the aquamarine color of Mexico's playas. The restaurant and grill ( parilla) serves delicious food and just ask if you want something special you will be surprised!! I was thrilled with this vacation and will return, if not this summer, next fall. I would recommend it to anyone and there's so much for families to do. But it's a great place for couples, singles, and people who want a relaxing, peaceful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: gcnels
Reviews.Content: We loved this place for all the right reasons! From the moment we entered the lobby, we felt we were in heaven! Our room was HUGE and we loved the gigantic verandas off the living and dining rooms! Although we did not spend much time in our room, it was a geat place to come home to after: lounging at 1 of the 2 pools, spending a day at the beach club, working out at the gym, eating at 1 of the 2 restaurants, shopping on 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen, or snorkelling in the beautiful Caribbean. This resort had everything we were looking for. We loved how small and quiet it was and how the staff took a personal interst in you and your holiday. Unlike some of the "mega resorts" we have been to, this one truly gave us a sense of relaxation. We would definitely go back! We do agree with past reviews that the beds are quite hard and the beach club bathrooms need serious upgrading. Other than that, we spent a week in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “The building was beautiful, but all the staff seemed to give conflicting info.”
Reviews.Author: ilse7
Reviews.Content: As for the positive things about this hotel, there were many - It was beautiful, the rooms were so nice (we stayed in a suite), the food at the grill by the pool was great, as well as the food at the beach. The beach was a bit of heaven brought down here to earth - absolutely loved it, and could have spent another week on the beach. The negative things were many though as well. The hotel staff seemed to be confused about how things worked - how much things cost at the spa, and who we were supposed to talk to about different activites. While the promotional trip to Xel-ha and Tulum was wonderful, going through the timeshare people was a big pain in the butt. It seemed as if everyone said "that's not my job" which meant a lot of time (1+ hour) sitting in the lobby, waiting for someone who could help us.The Royal Holiday people (timeshare) gave us conflicting information as well, and as soon as we told them that we weren't interested in the timeshare, they took their time in getting to us and our concerns. Also, day light savings time in mexico is different than in the USA. The hotel didn't give us any update that the time had changed, and therefore we almost missed our transportation. I would definitely stay there again (despite this review), because it was beautiful and relaxing. I would just avoid the timeshare people and the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden away retreat”
Reviews.Author: 2Travellers
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here by chance during the March break this year. Let us start by saying we tend to be more independent travellers, and this was thef irst time we actually did an entire week's worth of an all-inclusive type of vacation, so we obviously have no standard to compare to. However, we have visited other AI resorts on day trips, ( Palace, Iberostar, RUI,Sandals, etc) We had orginally booked our 1 BR timeshare at the Mayan Palace, ( (which was not AI) just outside of Playa Del Carmen, but were overwhelmed with the size and how busy the resort was , compared to how much smaller, quieter and peaceful it had been 5 years ago when we had last been there. We had booked the promo " timeshare" tour of HVR at the airport on our way in, and got a sunset cruise for 2 with lobster dinners for $64.00 US, which was a good deal . We had some problems getting there, as we were actually hijacked and taken to another similar named resort first... but we insisted on going to what we had booked and they eventually put us in a cab which brought us there. By then it was 11 AM and we were obviously late for our 9 AM breakfast meeting. The people at the resort who run the sales promotions were appalled at what had happened to us and refunded all the money we had paid, while still giving us the sunset cruise and dinner for free. Bonus! this gave us an excellent first impression of customer service, although it was probably just good business.- I think they were happy that we still showed up. Needless to say, we had breakfast, toured the resort, and found it to be the perfect kind of small, intimate resort that we prefer. And that is the key to this place- it IS small, and you have to be able to amuse yourself, or you will definately not find it to your liking. Bring a book, your walkman, and if need be your computer and own DVD's to amuse yourself as there is nothing offered at the resort. There are no pool activities, no shows, no entertainment of any sort- for that you would have to either go in to Playa or Cancun itself. The service is laid back and very Mexican- nothing happens in a hurry, so if you are an "A" type it might not be to your liking unless you are trying to slow down the pace for a week. Everything was clean, and we thought it was well maintained overall.. We thought the room was nice, although a bit small ( we had a studio, and our window did open to the outside, although we did meet other poeople with inside rooms who did feel it was 'dungeonlike' ), but since they allowed us to move from the MP we felt that we should not be overly cirtical as they basically offered us what they had available. We did have to purchase the AI plan, and felt that it was worth the money. However, I do agree with other traveller's comments that bit more variety in menus would have been appreciated. We found the overall quality of the food to be very good - they claimed it was gourmet, but for that distinction they have to work a bit harder( food & beverages/alchohol selection at RUI Palace RV and resorts of that qaulity still better by far, but then you also pay more, there ).The staff were always ready to try to honour any special request ( one morning we asked them to cook up some quaker oats we had brought with us, which they did). Unlike some other travellers here , we found the personnel to be very friendly and helpful. I found it interesting that someone said they paid $ 10 for the van to take them to the beach club-we missed the shuttle as I was late coming back from a spa appointment, and I had to pay $ 25 US to get them to drive me one way ( my husband decided to stay by the pool up at the spa that day). Be warned that the shuttle only runs at specific times... both there and back. The beach is beautiful, but with the exception of about 2 small places everything else has been destroyed by recent hurricanes and not rebuilt, so there is really nothing to do there except swim & tan. There is small eating area, and I had no problem as they had my favorite lunch item of shrimp , so I have no complaints. My only reservation was the washrooms, which were out of commission- and had to be ' pail flushed'- they definately need to be attended to! Beware there are no change rooms on site that we could find. My husband really enjoyed the salt water jacuussi pool and the pool upstairs by the dining room , although they could use more shade up there as it is sweltering during the day. I preferred the beach, although it was nice to come back and warm up in the salt water pool & heated chairs. after the beach which was cooler and very windy this year compared to previous years at this time. The spa treatements I had were great, although pricewise they are about the same cost as here, so don't expect any bargains.( about $ 130 for an hour & half massage) Several people told me they went into town and found much cheapoer massages etc., but iIconfess i liked the ambiance at the spa itself, and I guess that is built into the price. Plus I could walk back to my room, or the pool, or wherever afterwards and continue relaxing, so for me it was worth it. Overall, we feel we got our money's worth, and are already looking forward to coming again next year, although we will try to get a 1 BR room with a balcony rather than just a studio next time , as the studio room does become a bit cramped feeling after several days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: cleanse
