Reviews.Content: As RCI members this was the only hotel available during spring break. I didn't want to be in Cancun with the rowdy crowd so Playa seemed a better pick. I was nervous because it is not on the beach. We were picked up at our hotel in Cancun where we arrived the night before. The shuttle was free to the hotel but is not on the way back. We were pleased when we saw the lobby. It is open and truly unique. You will also notice the mayan style pyramid spa. Our room was wonderful. We had a one bedroom with a pull out sofa for our teenage daughter. Two double beds in the room for myself, husband and son. The room was large and well furnished. We loved the verandah and front balcony. We actually spent some time in our hotel room and usually never do because they are so small or unclean. They drive you to the beach with a shuttle van which is a 20 minute ride. It goes by quickly and the beach is very private with your much hoped for white sand with clear blue water. We had the all-inclusive and enjoyed lots of food anytime we wanted. There isn't anything to do at the beach but swim, walk, eat and tan. Both our children enjoyed it and weren't bored. We would go to the pool at the hotel afterwards to hang out till dinner and eat there in our cover-ups, very nice to not have to get dressed if you didn't want to. Our 5 yr. old could swim while waiting for dinner and sat down at the last minute to eat. Great for moms who want to relax while the kids swim... you eat. At breakfast my son made friends with the turtles and iguanas by the golf course lake and we always enjoyed the food. Walking to town was nice and we went several times. It's about 15 mins. We liked feeling that we could come and go and not be stuck at some huge hotel. I really liked the area and town. We found a dive shop there right next to the public beach, can't remember the name. Julio was our dive master and there were only the 3 of us on the boat. I wasn't expecting much, not like Cozumel anyway but it was a good dive. He took us to Tortugas and we sure saw lots of them. About 6 or 7. I touched 2 and they seemed so docile. One big turtle just let me rub his shell for quite a while. We went on a reef after that and saw tons of fish, schools of grunts, eels, a huge crab etc. We rented a car for 2 days and wished we had added a day. They packed us a lunch that we put in a cheap styrofoam cooler we bought at the super. We drove to Tulum, Akumal (visit Yal-Ku lagoon here) and snorkeled in Dos Ojos cenotes (north of and cheaper than Hidden Worlds cenotes). At Dos Ojos check out Yibran Aragon, tell him we said Hi! (Sherrie Hellickson and family from Houston) He has a little hut there where he can download the pictures he takes of you and your family snorkeling or diving. He also guides the dive trips. I have to mention the spa. Although we paid nothing for any spa treatments, just using what was free as part of our all-inclusive was fantastic! Everynight I would go to the sauna, steam room , thalsso therapy pool etc. to relax and unwind. My husband who is not usually into jacuzzi's and such even enjoyed it. My 16 yr. old climbed the rock wall and we all loved the restaurant on top. Do take advantage of it. We would go back and loved the quiet atmosphere, spa and town close by. Nothing is perfect but we felt this was close enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “peace and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: jdzOklahoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and absolutely loved this place! The hotel and spa were amazingly beautiful. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We were here for a week and loved every minute of the quiet and relaxation. The rooms were very clean. It is in walking distance to town or you can catch a cab. The food was wonderful! We are planning on going back on our fifth anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: stevesmallhomes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for only 1 night . We were booked for a week at another place in Playa, but we decided to come a day sooner and they didn't have a room available, so we were just looking for a place to crash the first night. We found this place on Orbitz with a deal that sounded too good to be true: $189 a night for All-Inclusive! Well, when we got there, we found out that it was, in fact, not true. We're positive it said all AI when we booked it, otherwise we would have found something cheaper, but looking over my confirmation I saw that I didn't have it in writing. Oh well, lesson learned. It was still a decent price just for the room. The property is nice, new looking, clean and well maintained. Since we were only there 1 night, we didn't go to the beach club. There are 2 pools, however, that we did visit. The main pool was average and there weren't enough chairs, but the pool on the roof of the spa is fantastic. It is on the 3rd floor with a great view, and comfortable beds (better than the bed in the room) instead of lounge chairs. There are also 2 restaurants. We had lunch at the poolside grill, which also overlooks the golf course. Pretty decent sandwich and fries. We also had breakfast there. Good but kind of pricey-you could do much better for breakfast in Playa. We tried the Jazmin restaurant for dinner. They describe it as International--the night we were there they had Asian and Italian. We had Italian selections which were very good and reasonably priced (about $15 per entree), and the service was very good. Overall, a pleasant stay, but if we were staying longer we would probably have wanted a place on the beach for convenience (the shuttle only runs out 2 times in the morning and back 2 times in the PM). Also, the bed was VERY firm-I wouldn't have liked that for many more nights. And I see Orbitz still offers AI options for this hotel-better make sure you have it printed in your confirmation if you go that way.

Reviews.Title: “HVR a great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: latinqt2
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in the lobby waiting for our taxi to pick us up to go home, and I must say we're sad to be leaving. It was our first time in the Cancun/PDC area and we were very impressed with all it had to offer. Our stay at HVR was relaxing. We had a studio room and were happy with the accommodations. The room and bathroom were very clean. Lots of closet space. The staff was very friendly. We took advantage of the private beach they take you to, and it was nice. It got crowded at the pool on some days, but we had access to the Spa pool (very chic) and loved it better there (booked our trip with a free spa day pass). We thought the food was very good, but as all food in PDC/Cancun a bit overpriced (we did not do all-inclusive). Breakfast before the beach shuttle can get crowded, so get there early or plan to leave later. My only complaint was that there aren't enough servers or tables for the breakfast rush. Just be patient, or plan accordingly, they do their best. Overall a very pleasant stay. We would recommend the hotel to friends and family, and we hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to say, Not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Tanbliss_Klingsiek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Decemeber 6-13th, 2007. We had rented a vehicle from Cancun airport, found it a little difficult to find. Locals were not very helpful with giving directions. First impression of the resort was impressive, clean and well kept. Front desk staff was not friendly. Our room was in the center of the building which meant we had no windows. Room was very small, very hard mattress. Beautiful bathroom, marble & granite. Pool bar had an excellent breakfast, however, very slow, so don't eat here if you are in a hurry. Jazmin restaurant had good choices, but also very slow. Our dining time averaged 2 hours. So as long as you aren't on any time restrcitions it's fine. Service in either restaurant was satisfactory, nothing spectacular. The beach club is about 20 minutes away. We transported ourselves with our rental and found it very difficult to find. There is a hand-made wood sign at the end of the road. It is very secluded. The beach is beautiful, food and drinks were good. If you are looking for glamourous, this isn't the place. Everything was very basic, no beach sports, no music, just towels and chairs. The bathroom was clean. The Spa is very nice. The staff here isn't friendly. We did the couples massage, it was great! The fitness center was awesome, a lot of great equipment. We also loved the seawater jacuzzi pool. Very relaxing. Bring bug spray at night, the mosquitos are bad.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute great vacation location”
Reviews.Author: cvc2tn
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the Hacienda Vista Real, at Playa del Carmen, for nearly a week on our first vacation to Mexico. If you want excellent service, a friendly, helpful staff, and a quiet comfortable place to enjoy your vacation, books it now. Paul Celis runs an efficient operation, and his staff makes you feel like you are more than welcome. Everyone from the desk clerks, the restaurant staff to the spa personnel acts like they want you to return and are glad you are there. Be sure to ask for Sergio at the Jasmine Restaurant. and Jose' at the Iguana Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Needs urgently to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: GlobetroterCostaRica
Reviews.Content: During our stay in the Royal Hideaway we also inspected this hotel, here is what we found: The first impression is very good, a great looking Spa building, Hotel Entrance but once you look closely things do turn sour. Be remembered that this Hotel Property is 5 star Property. The armchairs in the hotel lobby are almost all broken and to say the least in a very poor condition. Maintenance issues from paining problems to electric cables to broken are damaged furniture. The Housekeeping department does not use service trolleys (at least not while we were there) and do place their new towels, bed sheets and so on directly on the floor. The Guest room is of a good size however the 3 we saw were in poor conditions in respect to Quality Standards expected in a 5 star hotel. The front desk (you can look in to it from the upper floors) was pretty messy and all in full Guest view, from papers, cables and other items to the way the Front desk was set up. The Employee Attitude was ok but for sure not out going and need improvement. The F&B service was ok, but nothing very special. Overall we both were not impressed at all with the Hotel Property. We then took a close look at their Spa, the building from the outside is very impressive, a copy of an old Mexican Pyramid with different design concepts in the inside over 3 floors. Please note that this Spa is not only for hotel guest you have also quite a large number of Guests on day tours coming to the place. In principal the idea with having different design concepts within one spa if fine, however it is not fully implemented in the Spa property. Further the place need urgently a full renovation since it is very much run down in almost all aspects. The Garden area is not kept up; the waterfall is a good idea but has many damaged parts. The locker and relaxing areas are also not up to the First Impression. I am sure once a renovation took place and the Spa property is put back on track, the Spa would offer a nice experience, however at present for sure not. Overall a good product but needs to be renovated and maintained in order to meet a 5 star standard and to continue meet other Product Quality Guest Service Standards and Amenities offered in this area of Cancun and Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review”
Reviews.Author: transport1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda between Jan. 12 and Jan. 20th of 2008. Any negative review of this resort is completely misguided. How anyone can come away with anything but a love of this place is completely beyond me. We have been to Mexico on vacation at least 7 times in the last nine years and for adults looking to relax in a romantic, beautiful, quiet setting it does not get much better. Point One- The rooms are wonderful. the suites are spacious and the singles are quaint and clean and wonderfully maintained. I like a firm mattress and that's what they are. The pillows are excellent and the rooms are beautiful with mexican decorations, marble baths and excellent soft linens. The complaint about noise from the hall is semi valid. But I have never stayed in a hotel that was full to capacity with travellers from wedding parties, to families, to couples that has not had hallway noise. Most places housekeeping is knocking by 8am. here they were not starting until at least 10am. One more item here. In every hotel I have ever been to in Mexico i have wound up with bed bug bites on my feet or every where else. I came back with not one bite. Point Two- I arrived on the 12th and my wife arrived on the 14th. Claudia and the front desk was wonderful in helping me with sending a driver to pick up my wife upon her arrival. This is just a microcosim of the professionalism and service that you will experience. Polite, considerate and gracious. For gods sake tip these people and you will not have an issue. Most of service folks work for about 10 pesos an hour. Don't be cheap. When you tip on your bill the tip is split 100 different ways. Tip individuals based on the service they perform with dollars or Pesos and you will not regret it. Point Three- The grounds are beautiful and the private beach is heaven. The beach is something out of a tropical dream. Do not miss the pool on top of the spa you will feel like you are on the Mediteranean. Point Four- The All Inclusive is not really all inclusive. If you plan on eating all your meals at the Hacienda you will not be happy. The All inclusive is basic. But do not let this deter you. The Hacienda is in Playacar which is totally safe to walk around. Playa Del carmen is a 15 minute walk or a 50 peso cab ride ( 3 min ). You can eat until you are blue in the face and ready to explode in Playa. Restaurants in town can range from inexpensive to very pricey but you are on vacation so explore and enjoy the food and especially the drinks. Point Five- The breakfast service is very slow. If you are in a rush you are in trouble. this was really my only complaint. we ended up walking into town in the morning where you have multiple breakfast options that are less expensive and better tasting. Do Not miss the breakfast buffet in town at $7.40 US and it is the best deal around and fantastic. One other point. take your time i town and walk up and down 5th ave and the beach. the beah is public and the views are great and all the lttle beach hotels serve cold beer great drinks and wonderful food at very reasonable prices. I could write for an hour but you will not find a better hotel in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: aero-rider
Reviews.Content: Arrived at HVR on afternoon of the 15th. My 1st impression was meeting the concierge in the main lobby/Palapa. Claudia is very friendly, courteous and helpful. The room we were in was a 1 bedroom, with kitchen, living room and a balcony facing the golf course. The room was clean and nicely decorated and in good repair. It is obviously well cared for. I was in Mexico in winter time for fresh air and sunshine, so I was greatly impressed with the open air dining area around the pool, the Iguana Grill .During the week that we were there, we took most of our meals at the grill, by choice. The food was great, the service was outstanding. During our stay we got to know most of the people working aroung the pool area and I must say that they bent over backward to make our visit a very pleasant experience. We dined at the Jasmin 1 evening. Maybe it was a slow night, but we were treated like royalty, an unforgetable meal and an impromptu table-side magic show was put on by our waiter, Fabian. I had never experienced all inclusive before, but I feel like we got more than our money's worth here. Their private beach, though it is a 15 minute ride away, is clean and well equipped to provide for your needs, be it food , drink, bathroom facilities,etc. We thoroughly enjoyed 2 days basking on the beach and being catered to by David and his staff. Prior to our arrival at HVR, I was not sure what to expect. I can assure you that I would not hesitate to recommend this resort as a wonderful getaway. The entire staff was professional at all times and have a genuine desire to make your stay a pleasant one. The setting is quiet and layed back. Nightlife and excitement is a short cab ride away. I WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: christmastrip
Reviews.Content: We brought our two teenage daughters to Mexico for Christmas. We spent Dec 22 -29, 2007 at the Hacienda and then moved to the Blue Bay Cancun for 3 days. We had expected the girls to be a little bored during the first week but told them that the balance of the holiday would be their excitement...with more water sports and all inclusive activities. We opted for all inclusive in both resorts. To our surprise, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Hacienda, we were treated to wonderful meals, great service, and since the resort is small we got to know the other guests. We went to the beach everyday -a15-20 minutes by their shuttle, and we had such a great time. There isn't a lot to do, no activities - we read, and swam. The private beach is by far the nicest we've seen. We had a one bedroom suite, it big enough with two balconies and a view of the golf course. Compared to the two bedroom suite on the beach at the Blue Bay Cancun.....I still preferred the Hacienda. Here are our reasons... 1) lots of kid running around even at the bars at the Blue Bay 2) all meals were cafeteria style, with very little service 3) no bottled beer, all poured into 6 oz glasses 4) the beach was not as clean The hacienda is not perfect, they can forget to refill the mini bar ( refrigerator) but, if you call they will. Both resorts can be loud, more if there are lots of kids..... we were lucky that when we were at the Hacienda most of the people were couples and older families. But what sets it apart is it's people....if you are lucky enough to meet Sebastian, then you're set. We would go back to Hacienda Vista Real

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, but question the value”
Reviews.Author: RDBSantaRosa
Reviews.Content: The people, food and service were amazing and for this reason alone, we will consider returning. But the studio room was claustraphobic with barely a window and even less light. The outside hottubs were not working. There is little opportunity to explore. A cab or car is mandatory to get you out of Playacar and to the beach or city. The gym is an extra $10/day. "All Inclusive" was mandatory for us. This is an incredible expense that destroys any thought of "value". For what we paid, I would hope for a window and maybe a beach. But PlayDelCarmen was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Cheats”
Reviews.Author: YeaTravel
Reviews.Content: Decent room. The staff was not very good. But...This place charged me for 2 nights when I only stayed one. They did would not give a complete explanation for why. If you stay here be very careful about payment. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awseome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: AshKoetting
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Mexico. The resort was awesome, the pool with the swim up bar was very nice. We spent a day in the spa, it was like heaven. The beach was a 20 min. bus ride, that wasn't much fun because the bus was very hot and lots of traffic. This resort was not crowded at all, which is nice you could get right up to the bar and not have to wait for a table to sit. The staff was all excellent. I would recommened this resort very highly. I just wish it were on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely gorgeous place”
Reviews.Author: surletab
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, once in 2004 and again in 2006 when they had really upgraded and put in a beautiful new spa, a waterfall, a pool on the roof, and a restaurant on the roof. It's true the beach is 15-20 min. away by their bus, but it's secluded, unlike other beaches in the area which are mobbed. The food isn't gourmet, but it's good, service is excellent, rooms are beautiful. If you play golf, I don't think there's a better place to stay. No kids, quiet. If you have a large group, get the suite on the roof w/ a kitchen, a balcony. It's absolutely beautiful w/ a view of the jungle and the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but...”
Reviews.Author: livoor
Reviews.Content: After a business trip of 8 days, we spent 9 days at the Hacienda. The hotel is very pretty. Nice architecture and the rooms are decorated with taste, also the art work is gorgeous. Our suite was perfect. Also the SPA infrastructure is nice: lots of space, I think one of the biggest I've seen. The Spa is gorgeous, but SUPER EXPENSIVE. We expected to have some rest after our business trip, but the first two nights they had wedding-parties!! The staff is so disorganized. On arrival, we where not known... they all were so confused. The staff is to informal e.g. when I woke up in the morning, I opened the window to step into my terrace, the waiters downstairs near the pool area started greeting me, shouting my name ... Cleaning could be much better. I arranged for flowers ant petals for my wife upon arrival, if we wouldn't have taken those away after 5 days, those might still have been in the room. We had the all-in package. Which afterwards appeared to be a mistake: the offer is limited. although in the Jasmin, we had a good chef. Going downtown to have diner takes you at least 40mins. We tried to talk to the manager, impossible. He should spend less time on the golf course and more time in his hotel. This hotel misses professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Vista Real Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Carolacox
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home from our wonderful vacation in Playa Del Carmen. We stayed at the Hacienda Vista Real and it was great, and the staff was accommodating. They had computers so we could check with loved ones at home since our cells did not work. The housekeeping people refreshed our rooms daily and left a present on our beds every day. They shaped animals using towels and added flowers and vines; everything from a Basket (made from towels) to a turkey. There is a local beach but we choose to go to their "private beach" which they took us via van as it is 8 miles away and picked us up. The royal treatment continued at the beach. Dany was a great host and took care of us at the beach. Try the chicken nachos. We did alot of much needed R & R and Carlos, Fernando and Joel at the Igana Pool took care of us there when we were not at the pool. There we met other vacationers from all over the world. If they do not have the condiments for your favorite drink, Carlos will graciously substitute. We did go horse back riding at the Paradise Horse Riding and after the tour of the jungle; we went in the ocean via horseback. Our tour guides were great, the only suggestions is it would have been better if a lunch and drink were included. XCaret was a waste of time and money. Everything was extra and the paths were not well marked. We ate at the Buffet which they had a lot of seafood but nothing was cleaned. The shrimp had not only their heads on but also their antenna. The seafood stew was the same and the crab was still in the shells. We did enjoy the "Flying Guys". We do not recommend this activity. We walked down to Playa Del Carmen and shoped once. The walk was about 15-20 minutes so we got our exercise. It was our 5th anniversary and it was a great place to escape to!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this place”
Reviews.Author: deeben1
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful, BUT, BE CAREFUL.....It is little more than a front for a fraudulent travel club scam, in which hundreds of Americans and Canadians, including us, have been taken for hundreds of thousands of dollars and no services delivered. IT IS A SLICK SCAM. There is a yahoo group with approximately 400 of us who have been cheated by these crooks! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Once I found the SPA, I was fine”
Reviews.Author: NewPlace
Reviews.Content: 1) They have a gorgeous private beach...but it's 15 minutes away BY BUS. The are 2 buses in the am (10 and 11) and 2 at night (330p and 5p). You can't really come and go as you please. 2) The hotel is in a quiet, safe, secluded private community...but it's a walk to downtown bars & restaurants (~20 mins) 3) The breakfast is delicious ... but beware of b-fast included plans! Only the continental (bread & fruit) b-fast is included. 4) The standard rooms are spacious...but ours didn't even have a window. And hot water was limited. Bummer! 5) The SPA is world class, multiple pools, excellent service...but we discovered it our second day (ok, so that was our bad...) It really bugged me that the beach was far away because their website advertised as if it was on the property. The spa though, once we found it, more than made up for it! I rated it Above Average because it truly is a beautiful property. We forgave their short-comings midway through our stay and really had a wonderful vacation!!!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: debbiesray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I boarded a red eye flight from St. Louis to Cancun with my husband still in his tux. We were exhausted when we arrived. But the beauty took my breath away! The beauty of the ocean barely matched the beauty of the resort. We were treated like royalty. Needless to say our drinks were never empty! I actually cried when we had to leave. We will be back this year, I hope, for our 1st anniversary. There is no other place I would rather be on our special day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Adults”
Reviews.Author: DiDi2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hacienda Vista Real from April 3rd to April 10th over the Easter Holiday. I am a very picky traveler and did not know what I would be getting but to my surprise it was wonderful. The room was small but super clean and up to date with marble floors and shower to the granite countertops in the bathroom. I usually look at a number of different rooms before I except one but at this hotel the first room I saw was great. Pillows and sheets were great but the bed was hard but all hotels in Mexico are known for there hard mattresses. The beach was a 20 minute ride but well worth it once you got there breath taking. The hotel food was good and the beach food was good and service great. Don't be cheap when you tip they work hard and put in long hours and deserve to be treated fairly and for a little extra they will go out of there way to please you. Hotel is a 25 minute walk to town or a $5 taxi ride your choice but save your walking time and take a taxi to 5th Avenue because you will do alot of walking there. So many shops on 5th Avenue and so many eating places our favorites were La Parilla for lunch, Blue Lobster and Resturante de Bruno for dinner. Different experience from Cancun you have to try it. Great for people wanting to relax I am 43 and love to have fun and the Hacienda turned out to be a great choice. Be sure to tell Claudia at the front desk Mrs. Cole said Hello. Give this hotel a try and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fun place”
Reviews.Author: radsland21
Reviews.Content: I'm 15 years old, and I can say that almost nothing at Hacienda Vista Real would make me want to go back. The actual buildings were extremely well done, with the architectural theme being Mayan. The hotel is 20 minutes away from the beach, and they only have a bus that leaves twice in the morning to go there. The staff is very unprofessional. There are two restaurants, the Jazmin and the Iguana Cafe. At both the waiters would forget or misinterpret orders, and the first thing they asked was your room number, so they could charge you an outrageous tip being in the neighborhood of 20%. The meals themselves were expensive, with a simple plate of fruit costing $8.00. The staff could hardly speak english, and this made communication difficult. I can speak a little spanish, and the first night there, I saw our waiters mock us behind our back. The staff in general seemed lethargic and unresponsive. Often they would just stand around talking amongst themselves. Being 15, there was nothing at all for kids to do. No activities, no events, and no other kids. If you are reading this and your in high school, DO NOT GO, THERE IS NOTHING TO DO. I might recommend the hotel if you are going for a honeymoon, or if you are elderly and want to play golf in a nice quiet atmosphere. The all inclusive is a bad joke. You have a bevy of other fees to pay, and the enforced tipping will cost you probably more than the meals in the first place. At the Iguana Cafe, it will take at least an hour and a half to get your food. It is slightly less longer than the Jazmin. The pool and hot tub are nice, I just never saw a single person use either one in my entire 6 day stay their. On the plus side, the beach is incredible. Our bathroom did not have a door handle, and they replaced it after two days. Also, the shower had only cold water for a day, because they had "run out of propane". The room otherwise was quite accommodating. Any questions about Hacienda Vista Real email to [--]

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: dapar
Reviews.Content: There are some incredibly negative reviews on this site about this hotel. I think the world is becoming very spoiled. This was a great place. The SPA is in an incredible building that looks like a Mayan Temple. All the staff throughout were wonderful and friendly - much nicer than the Caribean or other countries. The food was a bit limited but was a good deal for an all inclusive. As many bottles of wine as you want (of specific brands of course)! The beach is off site but is a great private location with a nice staff that will get you everything. The studio room is a hotel room but it wasn't bad. All in all a very nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, good compromise”
Reviews.Author: RootHolyday
Reviews.Content: It was a good price for all inclusive 220 USD/night - a mexican environment - Maya architecture and good food, fitness equipment, jacuzzi but small pool. Located near the golf country club and parking services if you have a rent car - better to go to the center of Playa del carmen for shopping and beach. Basic services - clean, box, tv-dvd, radio, but helpful people at the front desk - we asked to change room 4 times because of better pleasing room (change floor, bath with movement). It's quiet and resting environment. Spa is quite expensive - 90USD for a Temazcal. It was intimacy and typical contrary to the hotels in cancun. If I could I'd go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place to Visit But Don't Stay There”
Reviews.Author: njsmartcookie
Reviews.Content: I wish I could be writing a good review because this is a beautiful hotel in a great location but there is absolutely nothing I can recommend after staying there. First of all, with only 73 rooms, they overbooked by no less than 7 rooms, so I spent my first night at the Holiday Inn which looks like a hospital. This is the first time it's ever happened to me, and I had already paid for the room for 8 nights! But misery loves company, and they overbooked/ displaced many other people. When I checked in I was given NO information. There is room service available but they don't tell you. The room has no instructions for phone calls and they don't tell you anything. The second restaurant (which is only open for dinner, not lunch) is actually in a different building, the spa which is next door (spa entrance is NOT included in your hotel stay and it's $50 just to go In). They have no activities, they don't tell you when or where meals are, nothing, nothing, nothing. The rooms are beautiful, and have great acoustics -- meaning you can hear everything!!! I was kept up by people in the next room -- the studios are not actually separate, they are bedrooms which are closed off from the suites. I got no peace, even after having the security guard knock on the door and asking them to quiet down. I was woken up every night either by them, or by a baby howling somewhere else. There is no rest to be had in this hotel, though the room was gorgeous with 20 foot arched ceilings. Food: boring,tateless. Orange juice pasteurized and watered down. Steak tasteless, all shrimp was mushy and nothing ever came hot even though most of it was cooked on a outside grill. (Even when it rained they did not open the dining room to let people inside to eat, they had us outside in the rain eating, and no I am not kidding and yes, I did ask them to open it). Every meal I had outside of the resort had more taste, although every meal I had outside the resort made me sick. Service: None existent. The head receptionist, Jessica would not even book a shuttle to the airport for me. (The hotel has their own shuttle which costs $60, a private taxi is $45 and other shuttles are $18). When she called and the hotel's shuttle was not available (she had not told me the price!!), she refused to help me any further. She and the other receptionists spent most of their time on the phone, it was nearly impossible to reach an operator from your room. Tour desk: They booked me on a $39 tour, where the entrance fee was only $2, and taxis about $7 each way. They booked me on another expensive tour where you have to be up at 5:30 a.m. and I waited and the bus never came. When I came back to the hotel, she got angry, called the company but I had to ask and go back twice for a refund and she never apologized. I asked to be referred to a time share and they wouldn't do it, but I recommend everyone else to go to a time share, because you get several expensive tours for free when you do go. Waiters: They invented the word greedy. I am a very good tipper, and at an all inclusive I would normally leave a large amount at the end of the week. The waiters instructed me to put it on the tab at each meal -- and a particularly greedy one -- his name started with an "O", instructed me to give him cash so he wouldn't have to split it with his fellow waiters. All of the waiters hover and stare at you as you write out the tip on the "checks" that you have to sign after all meals and drinks. If they don't see what you wrote, they open it as they take it off the table. But don't expect a "thank you" even if you tip 20 or 25%. Everyone at this place is not just out to put money in their own pocket, they are out to have you leave all your money in Mexico. There is really nothing to do at this hotel. The gardening staff refused to turn on the hot tub for me, there are no activities posted. There is certainly nothing to do here in the rain. The good part is that it is in a beautiful wealthy suburb (you have to pass through 2 guard posts to get into the area, which tells me it's not so safe), and it's only a $5 ride from the downtown area. I would not want to stay in the downtown area because aside from one street, Avenida Quinta, the rest of Playa del Carmen is squalid and rundown. I see no reason to recommend this hotel to anyone. Go somewhere bigger with more activities, better food (there were 3 meals a day, no snacks at this "all inclusive"). They take the cheap way out wherever possible here. They only have one small swimming pool, and only about 12 lounge chairs so that on sunny days it is still a challenge to get out early enough to get a lounger. Thumbs down. Go to Miami instead.

Reviews.Title: “Might go back, but shorter stay”
Reviews.Author: FabTravelBiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. I'm travel agent and we stayed with friends who are "V.I.P.'s" with HVR (something about points packages or RCI) I don't know their specific deal. We got a deal on the room and stayed 1 week. This being my 4th trip to Mexico, I am always open to trying new places/things. However, I can say that either I have become extremely spoiled from past visits, or my expectations are just too high. I have generally stayed within the Palace chain and this could well be the issue. Yes, it is very secluded and quiet. Only 1 pool, and 2 restaurants. The only thing that would cap off the quiet and seclusion is no kids, or at least making parents maintain their kids. Instead of there being 200 or 300 people at multiple pools, as with larger hotels, it was nice to be on of only 6 or 8 people at the pool. 1 of the restaurants (Jasmin) is INCREDIBLY expensive ($11 for an omelette, $8 for a fruit plate) - it was nothing to spend $35 USD for breakfast. A bit steep to me. The service was EXCELLENT. With the staff at HVR, guests want for absolutely nothing at any time. Sebatain, Flavio and Charly especially work very hard at keeping guests happy. My room was what they call a studio. Small room with a bed, bath and closet. No dresser or any where else to put clothes. Our friends were in the Monarch. They were a party of 8 and had a full service kitchen with basic utensils provided. Nice suite. The staff even cleaned up their dishes if they left them in the sink. A few things with our room. We could not regulate the temp in our room to save our lives. It was either freexing, or on the border of raining in the room from the moisture. No happy medium. The honor bar (fridge) was well stocked with $2 cans of pop and $6 tiny bottles of booze, etc. We moved this stuff to put items in for our week long stay only to fin the fridge was absolutely filthy. We had to literally peel items off the bottom of the fridge. I'm also used to the noise levels at hotels. Like hospitals, they are notorious for not allowing you to get any rest. The HVR takes this to an entirely new level. The windows in our room, which was on a corner, might as well have not been there at all. They were a slide style window similar to one in a Dr office reception area, just as thin, and rattled in their track when anyone talked or walked by. Folks might as well have just been standing in our room. We will definitely go back to Mexico, and would return to HVR if for nothing else to see the staff. I would definitely select a different room type/location though. For the most part, I will be returning to the Palace chain resorts that offer adult or couples only visitors. Yes, there can be a TON of people on these resorts but their service is unsurpassed on every level. Next stop, Moon Palace. Try Cancun Palace (family friendly last we knew) or Aventura Spa Palace (couples only). Also check out : [--] and book a dream vacation for yourself. You deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for my Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Tabulove
Reviews.Content: The service, the room, the food - the level of sophistication was unsurpassed - I love this place

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, high class”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTango
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas and New Year's weeks at HVR and had a great time. I don't know what all the complaints are about. If you're looking for an american style huge all inclusive, this is not for you. If you're looking for a quality hotel, quiet and with great service, this is probably the best resort in Playa. The staff was great, EVERYONE spoke english very well. We had a one bedroom, spectacular: marble floors, granite counter tops, solid wood doors, great golf course view, etc. We found the food great as well. Two restaurants, Jazmin (sit down a la carte) and Iguana Grill (by the pool and also a la carte). In our opinion, the food was very good, healthy, very well presented and appropriate quantity. This is not a "stuff your face" style buffet. This is a classy sit down restaurant. The food orders would take longer than what one is used to in North America, but that was the same in all other restaurants that we went to. This is Mexico, not USA or Canada. Embrace the culture, lower your expectations and you'll have a great vacation. I would not recomend it for families or young couples looking for activities. There are none. Great pool, probably the best stretch of beach in Playa and friendly staff. Because it's small, they get to know you and learn your preferences. Did not use the Spa, but toured it and it appears to be first class. We would definetely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: adaresboutique
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay at the Hacienda Vista Real....don't believe all the negative reviews! We were a party of 11 including 5 children. The staff at the Hacienda is fabulous and very accomodating especially with the children. We had 2 one bedroom units and a studio and all of the rooms were very nice and comfortable. The maids did a great job keeping the rooms clean. The hotel itself is gorgeous and kept spotless. The beach club is an approx. 20 minute ride from the hotel...they provide transportation if needed....and trust me....we were in this part of Mexico for two weeks and visited many beaches....the Hacienda's beach is one of the nicest beaches in this part of Mexico. The staff at the beach club was fabulous and very attentive. Dani and Sebastion rock!!! Food was great as well! Had a massage at the spa and I must say it was one of the best massages I have ever had! The one and only complaint I have about the Hacienda is the restaurant situation. We booked thru RCI and the all inclusive was mandatory. The pool side grill was not open the week that we were there and there was only one restaurant available....Jasmine....besides the beach club restaurant. While the food at the Jasmine was fine and the staff were very accomodating to the children....if you are going to charge $340 for 4 people for an all inclusive rate....you need to have more than one restaurant to choose from. The hotel is a short walk from 5th Avenue which is fabulous....lots of shops, restaurants, bars, whatever you are looking for. Check in and check out were a breeze. We had no problem with any of the staff not speaking English or being able to understand us as posted in other reviews. All in all we loved our stay at the Hacienda Vista Real!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: capecodsailor
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! They made everything right when we had issues. we had to move rooms 3 times. first room had a bad smell and drainage problem. No problem they moved us. Second room had noise from AC units and pool pump. No problem They moved us. 3rd room had kids next door who were very loud. No problem they moved us. 4th room was just right. Ask for a 3rd floor room away from the spa and close to the Pool Bar. The pool bar, Deli and one resturant were closed for repairs so all inclusive was alot for what you got. . one Resturant with a limited menu but they would cook off the menu if you requested. We are not big on Tia food or sushi which is what the spa resturant "Jazmin" had. I understand pool bar etc will be open in a few weeks. the Spa was ok .staff spoke spanglish. If you want lots of activites this is not the place for you. If you want to relax and need some down time this is the place. The private beach is about 10 km away and they provide transportation. Staff at beach was great but again no activities. no jet skis, sail boats etc. just a beautiful beach in the middle of no where with a "resturant" f you want to call it that. Taxi to down town and ferry to cozumel cost $5 but you can walk there in 20 min. We will go back but will check to besure everthing is up and running first.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, Awful, Awful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dluna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Vista Real in May with some friends AND I will NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!!! There was only one resturant available to us and only one pool. The service was terrible!!!! You'd order one thing and get something else, the waiters did not speak English at all!!! I didn't feel safe in our room.....MAYBE that was because our sliding glass door didn't LOCK!!! I was too afraid to tell the staff because I thought they might rip us off when we were out!!! Anytime we went into town the staff knew exactly what we did and where, I felt as if we were being followed!!! The staff was not honest at all!!! Everyone always had a different story or pointed the finger at someone else!! Be careful when you exchange your money at the front desk!!! Always count it and make sure you know what the exchange rate is....The staff is always trying to pull a fast one on you!!! BEWARE AND BE CAREFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: fashnmodl
Reviews.Content: I am quite confused of the bad reviews. I purchased a vacation certificate a couple of years ago from Premier. I initially had trouble getting the times that I wanted but after speaking to a manager (Carlos) he accomodated my needed. Im not going to write too much, but to sum it up, the food was great, the spa was a must, the service was the best Ive ever seen in all of my travels, the owner Mustafa was a sweetheart, and very down to earth. The staff was accomodating to our every needs, be it transportation, or issues. We had the one bedroom but if you can afford it, you MUST get the penthouse, its to die for. The only downsides is that the mattresses are hard. I read the reviews on this so I brought my air mattress. The poolside grill is delicious, and so is the Jasmine restaurant. Jorge was our waiter....he was awesome. Fidel was our waiter at the Jasmine...also awesome. This place is incredible. I will surely come back for some R & R.

HotelInfo.Name: Hacienda Vista Real
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo Xaman-Ha Ret. 3 Lotes 12 y 13 | Villas Pakal Playacar, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
